message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CR 

This paper deals with problems related to image segmentation, denoising, registration, and 3D reconstruction, which are all topics commonly studied in the computer vision (cs.CV) field. The paper proposes a new approach to training conditional random fields (CRFs) using probably approximately submodular constraints, which is a machine learning (cs.LG) technique. The paper also discusses the use of pairwise potentials, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for modeling relationships between variables. The paper also mentions the submodularity inequality, which is a concept from discrete mathematics and optimization (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the NP-hardness of the graph cut algorithm, which is a topic in computational complexity theory (cs.CR).
